news_header: Ron Ely, the actor known for his role as Tarzan, has died at the age of 86.
news_text: Ron Ely, famous for portraying Tarzan in the 1960s TV series, passed away at 86. His daughter, Kirsten Casale Ely, expressed her grief on Instagram, calling him one of the greatest men. Ely, who performed his own stunts and faced numerous challenges during filming, retired from acting in 2001 but later published two mystery novels and made a brief return in 2014. He was also known for appearances in popular shows like The Love Boat and Wonder Woman, and hosted the Miss America pageant in the early 1980s. Ely died at his home in Santa Barbara, California, on September 29.
